result.execSummary:
The defendant Delvin A Hawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1158 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Payments of $25/mo to commence 09/15/2022
Letter to Delvin Hawkins from Clerk of Courts Office. The incorrect total of $658.00 was originally given at the service window. Letter indicates $1,158.00 is the correct amount.

Defendant Delvin A Hawkins in court with attorney Reed Cornia for Jason Gonzalez.  Attorney Paul W. Humphrey in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. $500 plus court costs. Argument. DNA ordered.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Court orders $500 plus court costs. 

DNA ordered.

Becky K
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

02:23 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

01:34 PM Defendant appeared.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is planning to hire a private attorney.  Case rescheduled to allow defendant to retain counsel. Warrant vacated.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
03:44 PM Defendant did not appear.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Zoom
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court hearing or the conclusion of this case. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:37 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
